messages.subject: all that learning: so little teaching!!
messages.messageBody:
, >Hi all,
>In the past two hours this is what my 10yo daughter has done
>she has practised her:
>reading skills,
>comprehension skills,
>ability to follow instructions
>applied logic and problem-solving skills
>hand-eye co-ordination
>fine motor skills
>silent sustained concentration
>on-task focusing
>displayed awareness of regional accents and vocabulary
>enriched her word-bank
>displayed persistence in attaining her goals
>refused to stop in face of repeated "failures"
>provided ongoing verbal and written self-assessment
>done maths addition and subtraction to six places
>practised mental computations
>has used logic in predicting likely outcomes
>has used deductive reasoning in problem-solving exercises
>practised listening skills
>narration skills
>done several empathy-building exercises
>used deductive reasoning and synthesised information
>explored concepts of time measurement
>investigated the theory underlying hourglasses
>familiarised herself with basic astronomical terms
>done two exercises in graphic arts
>including image selection, layout and vocabulary choices.
>
>Yep Am I the world's greates unschooling mother or what?? Ashley has been
>playing "Sabrina"on the CD-Rom!!!
>
>
>Yay for delight-driven, child-led learning!
>
>
>Regards,
Michelle
